description: The federal appeals court in Richmond, Va., ruled in favor of transgender patients on Monday. The case was brought by Medicaid recipients in West Virginia and state employees in North Carolina.
title: Transgender health care must be paid for by state insurance, says an appeals court

description: And the numbers in 2024 aren't looking any better. Why is this highly infectious disease on the rise? And how can it be tamed?
title: The jump in measles cases in 2023 is 'very concerning' says WHO official

description: Under a related deal, users who return devices by Aug. 9 can get an extra $100. As part of the recall, the company is offering repairs, replacements or refunds of the machines' cost.
title: What consumers should know as Philips agrees to $1.1 billion CPAP settlement

description: Our April roundup of expert advice includes a nifty negotiation tactic, guidance on how to prevent digital eye strain and why you should travel during 'shoulder season.'
title: How much should I spend on a wedding present? Life Kit's tips of the month

description: Ondine Achampong says she tore her ACL during a bars dismount. The surgery and recovery from the knee injury can take up to a year. She was expected to be a medalist at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics.
title: Top British gymnast Ondine Achampong tears ACL, may miss Paris Olympic Games

description: The World Health Organization has issued a report updating terminology and explanations regarding the spread of the novel coronavirus. See if you're up on the latest vocab.
title: Quiz: Can you pass our 9 question test on the latest theories of COVID-19 transmission

description: Students continue to protest at campuses across the country, despite the risk of arrest. Some schools now threaten demonstrators with disciplinary action, while others promise the opposite.
title: As student protesters get arrested, they risk being banned from campus too

description: The International Criminal Court is reportedly preparing arrest warrants for Netanyahu and other Israeli officials. What the latest abortion lawsuit has to do with new rights for pregnant workers
title: ICC reportedly weighs arrest warrants for Israeli officials; new abortion lawsuit

description: Plenty of people go to couples therapy — why not siblings therapy? Experts say the long, complicated relationships between siblings are worth exploring and tending to.
title: All grown up, but still fighting? Why more siblings are turning to therapy, together

description: A trial for a mass environmental injury case begins in Hawaii on Monday, more than two years after a U.S. military facility poisoned thousands of people when it leaked jet fuel into drinking water.
title: Military families in Hawaii spark trial over 2021 jet fuel leak that tainted water

description: Although HIV transmission from contaminated blood through unsterile injection is a well-known risk, the CDC said this is the first documentation of probable infections involving cosmetic services.
title: CDC says 3 women diagnosed with HIV after receiving 'vampire facial'

description: The aid group said the humanitarian situation in Gaza remains dire and that it has almost 8 million meals ready to distribute. The group halted efforts after Israeli strikes killed seven workers.
title: World Central Kitchen says it will resume operations in Gaza
